title: AB 1640
content: The people of California enact the following. Section 7522.02 of the Government Code is amended to apply to all state and local public retirement systems and participating employers, including various specific systems and individual retirement plans. The article is subject to the Internal Revenue Code and the California Constitution, with administration requirements complying with relevant codes. The article exempts certain entities and public employees from its application based on specific criteria outlined in federal and state laws. Retirement plans approved before January 1, 2013, by excluded entities are not affected. Additionally, public employees protected under federal law prior to December 30, 2014, are also exempt unless certain conditions are met. The article exempts certain public employees from its application based on specific criteria outlined in federal and state laws. New public employees are required to participate in the benefit plan outlined in the article. Individuals transitioning between public employers are subject to the retirement plan available to employees of the subsequent employer before January 1, 2013. Individuals who changed employment positions before January 1, 2013, and moved to a different public retirement system offered by their employer will be subject to the defined benefit plan available to employees hired on or before December 31, 2012. If a public employer offered a defined benefit pension plan with a lower cost formula before January 1, 2013, they can continue with that formula. However, if they adopt a new formula after that date, it must meet certain requirements or be approved by the Legislature. New members can only join the lower cost formula or an approved one. If a public employer offers a retirement benefit plan consisting solely of a defined contribution plan before January 1, 2013, they can continue with that plan. However, if they adopt a new defined benefit pension plan or formula after that date, it must meet specific requirements or be approved by the Legislature. New members can only participate in the existing defined contribution plan or an approved plan. If the Cities of Brea and Fullerton form a joint powers authority after January 1, 2013, they can offer employees the same defined benefit plan they had before. Other cities in Orange County can join this authority by January 1, 2017, with a limit of three cities. The formation of a joint powers authority after January 1, 2013, cannot exempt new employees or members from the requirements of the article. New members must participate in a defined benefit plan that complies with the article. The Judges’ Retirement System is not required to adopt certain benefit formulas or compensation limitations. This article does not provide membership in a public retirement system for ineligible individuals. Public retirement systems must modify their plans to comply with the article's requirements by January 1, 2013.
